In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        
        if !isempty(wrapped_text)
            wrapped_text *= " "
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= word
        line_length += length(word) + 1 # Add one to account for the space character.
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"))
```

This will output:

```
Lorem
ipsum
dolor
sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit
```
